3: Huaxu, are you there?
I don't know what 'there' refers to, but I am currently in my active start-up cycle. Next start-up cycle is in...
I don't care about that.
That conversation you showed me earlier...
Are you referring to the hour-long conversation?
Yes. Play it back for me again.
As you wish.
Huaxu, how can humanity survive under such circumstances?
All data has been parsed, but no such method exists.
Regardless of the method, humanity will only end in destruction.
Earth has already experienced five mass extinctions. Humanity is merely just a visitor on this age-old planet.
After hearing Huaxu's response, Qu slowly closes her eyes.
According to the consciousness simulation, you already know the answer to this question before asking me. Why did you ask me?
Qu stands there in silence.
The motion sensor has detected that you have not moved in over 20 seconds.
Can we only place our hopes in the future? But people in the present...
I don't understand your question.
That was a rhetorical question, Huaxu...
What if we expand the scope of civilization from humanity to incorporate the rest of the Earth?
Would you still give me the same response, Huaxu?
But this conflicts with your original intent.
A goal is worthless if it is unattainable at the onset.
I want something that can actually be achieved.
I've adjusted the input range and parameters to meet your requirements.
I want results.
Very low probability, but not impossible. Changing the scope has made certain options possible now.
...That'll do.
Why do you say so?
Perhaps, I am beginning to understand my mixed emotions.
The recording ends here.
Don't you find it strange that you are showing me this piece of information?
I am simply presenting the facts as they were. That is all.
I cannot comprehend what has led you to form this view.
I have detected silence that does not conform to the logic of the current conversation.
All I know is, what you showed me was not what I had asked for. And that it's not what we decrypted from your main memory.
So, as an AI without emotions... Who inspired you to show me these records?
I didn't think an AI could fall silent.
—This involves highly classified information.
Very well...
We will find out... Whether you like it or not.
Say... Maybe even now.
—Digital signature 87533-DE4 error.
Looks like you aren't very good at keeping secrets.
This digital signature leads to the record you just showed me. I need to know who left it. Tell me.
Unauthorized access. Unauthorized access. Unauth—Access granted.
Code 87533-DE4 is the Kowloong Chamber of Commerce's highest encryption authority. It was directly signed by the leader and encapsulated with a permanent digital watermark.
—I must not divulge this information.
If there is something I want to know, you can't hide it from me. Don't blame yourself, even though I know you won't.
So... Why would the leader of Kowloong want to give this information to the enemy?
Additional information on the signature uncovered. Shall I display it?
...I see. This Kowloong leader even knew I'd get my hands on this information.
Show me.
—'I already know who saw this message, but I want to clarify something.'
'Kowloong and the Tabula Akasha are just necessary measures taken with the belief that mankind is bound to perish.'
'But I'm not afraid. Even if there is the smallest of chances, I believe in the possibilities of mankind.'
'So if anyone can defeat me and take Huaxu...'
'The moment Huaxu is taken, I will decrypt all of the memory files. There's no need to waste time. These files are necessary to rebuild civilization.'
'—KCC Leader, Qu'
—Playback complete.
I have once more detected silence that does not conform to the current conversation logic.
...Perhaps.
This explains why we extracted data from the database almost effortlessly.
...Even effortlessly finding information on 'an experimental high-gain antenna cluster belonging to the World Government' buried somewhere in the Arctic Route Union.
I have trouble parsing whether your speech is sarcastic or complacent.
Perhaps both?
After all, your leader must have never expected you to end up in the hands of humanity's enemy when leaving this message.
I am unable to discern your relations to human civilization, but I will faithfully execute the orders of Lady Qu.
Aren't you curious about what I will do when I get my hands on the antenna cluster?
—Maybe I'll just act like the people before the Golden Age, wearing wreaths on their heads, broadcasting pop music around the world?
I have no 'curiosity' function. If that is what you want, I am only programmed to tell you how to achieve your goal.
...How dull.
Forget it. The last puzzle piece is up ahead.
Let's finish this. I'm getting sick of humanity.
